alert.note: Alert for De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 01 at 3:47PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN LINCOLN...WEST CENTRAL DE BACA AND SOUTHWESTERN GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM MDT... At 347 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 16 miles south of Vaughn, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northern Lincoln, west central De Baca and southwestern Guadalupe Counties. This includes the following highways... Highway 285 between Mile Markers 184 and 202. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 274 and 295. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County
